trans-unit.source: Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games
trans-unit.target: Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games

trans-unit.source: We show how to use DirectX programming to implement the fundamental concepts of 3D graphics.
trans-unit.target: We show how to use DirectX programming to implement the fundamental concepts of 3D graphics.

trans-unit.source: Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games
trans-unit.target: Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: We show how to use DirectX programming to implement the fundamental concepts of 3D graphics.
trans-unit.target: We show how to use DirectX programming to implement the fundamental concepts of 3D graphics.

trans-unit.source: **Objective:** Learn to program a 3D graphics app.
trans-unit.target: **Objective:** Learn to program a 3D graphics app.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: We assume that you are familiar with C++.
trans-unit.target: We assume that you are familiar with C++.

trans-unit.source: You also need basic experience with graphics programming concepts.
trans-unit.target: You also need basic experience with graphics programming concepts.

trans-unit.source: **Total time to complete:** 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: **Total time to complete:** 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Where to go from here
trans-unit.target: Where to go from here

trans-unit.source: Here, we talk about how to develop 3D graphics with DirectX and C++\\Cx.
trans-unit.target: Here, we talk about how to develop 3D graphics with DirectX and C++\\Cx.

trans-unit.source: This five-part tutorial introduces you to the [Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh309466) API and the concepts and code that are also used in many of the other DirectX samples.
trans-unit.target: This five-part tutorial introduces you to the [Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh309466) API and the concepts and code that are also used in many of the other DirectX samples.

trans-unit.source: These parts build upon each other, from configuring DirectX for your UWP C++ app to texturing primitives and adding effects.
trans-unit.target: These parts build upon each other, from configuring DirectX for your UWP C++ app to texturing primitives and adding effects.

trans-unit.source: **Note** This tutorial uses a right-handed coordinate system with column vectors.
trans-unit.target: **Note** This tutorial uses a right-handed coordinate system with column vectors.

trans-unit.source: Many DirectX samples and apps use a left-handed coordinate system with row vectors.
trans-unit.target: Many DirectX samples and apps use a left-handed coordinate system with row vectors.

trans-unit.source: For a more complete graphics math solution and one that supports a left-handed coordinate system with row vectors, consider using [DirectXMath](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437833).
trans-unit.target: For a more complete graphics math solution and one that supports a left-handed coordinate system with row vectors, consider using [DirectXMath](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437833).

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Using DirectXMath with Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff729728#Use_DXMath_with_D3D).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Using DirectXMath with Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff729728#Use_DXMath_with_D3D).

trans-unit.source: We show you how to:
trans-unit.target: We show you how to:

trans-unit.source: Initialize [Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh309466) interfaces by using the Windows Runtime
trans-unit.target: Initialize [Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh309466) interfaces by using the Windows Runtime

trans-unit.source: Apply per-vertex shader operations
trans-unit.target: Apply per-vertex shader operations

trans-unit.source: Set up the geometry
trans-unit.target: Set up the geometry

trans-unit.source: Rasterize the scene (flattening the 3D scene to a 2D projection)
trans-unit.target: Rasterize the scene (flattening the 3D scene to a 2D projection)

trans-unit.source: Cull the hidden surfaces
trans-unit.target: Cull the hidden surfaces

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If youâ€™re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If youâ€™re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).

trans-unit.source: Next, we create a Direct3D device, swap chain, and render-target view, and present the rendered image to the display.
trans-unit.target: Next, we create a Direct3D device, swap chain, and render-target view, and present the rendered image to the display.
